messages.message:
Hi all!  The latest Mac update kidnaps port 5000 for AirPlay. Since we run the webapp on port 5000, this messes with local development. This is a silent failure if you use provisioner--`ppy status` still shows webapp's status as ok!

If you'd like to turn off AirPlay and free the port, here's a short medium article about it. (https://anandtripathi5.medium.com/port-5000-already-in-use-macos-monterey-issue-d86b02edd36c). I'm unsure if others have run into this, so I thought I'd share!
Thanks! Kinda weird that they would choose 5000 for their defaultâ€¦
How much effort is required to change our webapp port to something else? I can foresee this issue cropping up in the future (esp. for new hires) and we should nip it in the bud right now.

Please beware of the impact of changing any ports like this on our customers. Many have default deny-all network policies for pod-pod communication within the K8s namespace and therefore have set explicit K8s network policies to allow communication on all ports required by Instabase services.

This change would need to be carefully documented and the change managed through our customer's environments via the Instabase TAMs
maybe we can be clever here and change the docker container port to something else and then port map it in the k8s service so customers are not affected.
